IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: WINCHESTER GARDENS IS AN ACCREDITED CONTINUING CARE RETIREMENT COMMUNITY.
IRS990.MissionDescription: WINCHESTER GARDENS IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING MATURE ADULTS AN ACTIVE LIFESTYLE THAT FOSTERS DIGNITY, PRIVACY, INDIVIDUALITY AND INDEPENDENCE IN A CARING ENVIRONMENT. THIS IS ACHIEVED THROUGH A HIGHLY SKILLED AND CONCERNED STAFF PROVIDING EXCEPTIONAL SERVICE WITH A FOCUS ON RESIDENT NEEDS AND DESIRES.
IRS990.Description: DURING 2010, 241 RESIDENTS WERE PROVIDED A TOTAL OF 75,536 DAYS OF RESIDENCY IN THE 162 APARTMENTS AND 40 VILLAS UNDER THE TERMS OF THEIR CCRC CONTRACTS. THE AVERAGE AGE OF THE INDEPENDENT LIVING RESIDENTS AS OF DECEMBER 31, 2010 WAS 87.6 YEARS.DURING 2010, 144 RESIDENTS WERE PROVIDED A TOTAL OF 31,697 DAYS OF CARE IN THE HEALTH CENTER. THE AVERAGE AGE OF THE HEALTHCARE RESIDENTS AS OF DECEMBER 31, 2010 WAS 88.8 YEARS.OF THE 144 RESIDENTS IN THE HEALTH CENTER, 76 RECEIVED 14,321 DAYS OF CARE UNDER THE TERMS OF THE CCRC RESIDENCY AGREEMENTS AND RECEIVED DISCOUNTS TOTALING $816,000 WHEN COMPARED TO RATES CHARGED TO DIRECT ADMIT RESIDENTS. OF THE 68 DIRECT ADMIT RESIDENTS (WHO RECEIVED 17,376 DAYS OF CARE) WINCHESTER GARDENS PROVIDED $834,800 OF CHARITABLE ASSISTANCE TO 25 RESIDENTS (FOR A TOTAL OF 7,735 DAYS) UNDER THE TERMS OF A REDUCED RATE DIRECT ADMIT CONTRACT IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE TERMS OF A COURT-APPROVED CONSENT AGREEMENT MODIFYING THE WILL OF MARCUS L. WARD OR THROUGH PARTICIPATION IN THE NJ ASSISTED LIVING MEDICAID WAIVER PROGRAM.

IRS990ScheduleA.GeneralExplanation: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 12, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME: MISCELLANEOUS INCOME MEAL REVENUE PARKING REVENUE BEAUTY/BARBER SHOP PRIVATE FUNCTION REV RECOVERY OF BAD DEBTS ALL OTHER REVENUE

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION PAYS DUES TO LEADING AGE, A MEMBER ORGANIZATION WHICH SUPPORTS SENIOR LIVING FACILITIES. A PORTION OF THE DUES PAID ARE ALLOCABLE TO LOBBYING EXPENSES. THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF DUES PAID THAT ARE ALLOCABLE TO LOBBYING IS $920.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: FOR RESIDENTS DIRECTLY ADMITTED TO THE HEALTH CENTER, WINCHESTER HOLDS A ONE MONTH ESCROW PAYMENT THAT IS APPLIED TO THEIR ACCOUNT IN THE MONTH OF MOVE OUT. WINCHESTER ALSO COLLECTS WAIT-LIST DEPOSITS AND 10% DEPOSITS FOR POTENTIAL RESIDENTS WHO MOVE INTO INDEPENDENT LIVING APARTMENTS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: DESCRIPTION OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS UNDER FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: WINCHESTER GARDENS FOLLOWS THE PROVISIONS OF FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS BOARD ("FASB") INTERPRETATION NO. 48, "ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES - AN INTERPRETATION OF FASB STATEMENT NO. 109" ("FIN 48"). FIN 48 CLARIFIES THE ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES RECOGNIZED IN A COMPANY'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND PRESCRIBES A RECOGNITION THRESHOLD OF MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT TO BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY THE APPROPRIATE TAXING AUTHORITY. MEASUREMENT OF THE TAX UNCERTAINTY OCCURS IF THE RECOGNITION THRESHOLD HAS BEEN MET. FIN 48 ALSO PROVIDES GUIDANCE ON DE-RECOGNITION, CLASSIFICATION, INTEREST AND PENALTIES, AND DISCLOSURE. MANAGEMENT HAS DETERMINED THAT FIN 48 DOES NOT HAVE A MATERIAL EFFECT ON THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. WINCHESTER GARDENS' FEDERAL RETURNS OF ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX FOR THE YEARS ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2009, 2008, AND 2007 REMAIN SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT, THE CEO AND THE DIRECTOR OF MARKETING ARE PROVIDED WITH HOUSING ON THE CAMPUS IN A BUILDING OWNED BY WINCHESTER GARDENS. THIS IS NOT TREATED AS TAXABLE COMPENSATION TO THE CEO OR THE DIRECTOR OF MARKETING.
EXPENSES INCURRED IN THE MAINTENANCE AND OPERATION OF THE EMPLOYER-PROVIDED HOUSING ARE PAID DIRECTLY BY WINCHESTER GARDENS.

WINCHESTER GARDENS SPONSORS A NON-QUALIFIED RETIREMENT PLAN FOR THE PRESIDENT/CEO. THE PLAN IS STRUCTURED TO PROVIDE A LUMP SUM PAYMENT AT RETIREMENT THAT WILL PROVIDE AN ANNUAL RETIREMENT BENEFIT OF $150,000 FOR THE LIFE OF THE CEO. THE EXPENSE INCURRED IN 2010 WAS $200,405.

Form990ScheduleKPartV.ReturnReference: DIFFERENCE BETWEEN ISSUE PRICE AND TOTAL PROCEEDS
Form990ScheduleKPartV.Explanation: THE BOND ISSUE OF $35,810,000 AND $10,000,000 HAD ORIGINAL ISSUE DISCOUNTS TOTALING $88,350. THE AMOUNT ACCOUNTS FOR THE ENTIRE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE ORIGINAL ISSUE PRICE AND THE TOTAL PROCEEDS.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: MR. REINER OWNS WARREN G. REINER, INC., WHICH IS AN INSURANCE BROKER THAT PROVIDES SERVICES TO WINCHESTER GARDENS. NOTE THE AMOUNT REPORTED IS ENTIRELY PREMIUMS, NOT PAYMENT FOR SERVICES RENDERED.THE BOARD MAINTAINS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND ALL TRANSACTIONS WITH MR. REINER'S FIRM ARE CONDUCTED AT ARM'S LENGTH.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE SPOUSE OF MARY ANN MOORE, BOARD MEMBER, IS EMPLOYED AT THE SAME FIRM AS ROBERT CHILSTROM, VICE CHAIRMAN. THE ORGANIZATION USES THE PREPARATION AND REVIEW OF ANNUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENTS TO DETERMINE WHETHER A FAMILY OR BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP EXISTS BETWEEN OFFICERS, TRUSTEES AND KEY EMPLOYEES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 3
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: WINCHESTER GARDENS UTILIZED THE SERVICES OF SB&A ASSOCIATES TO PROVIDE DIRECT MARKETING OVERSIGHT AND THE SERVICES OF SODEXO TO PROVIDE MANAGEMENT OVERSIGHT OF THE DINING OPERATIONS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE AUDIT COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE INITIAL DRAFT OF THE FORM 990 FILING. AFTER THIS REVIEW, A DRAFT IS CIRCULATED TO THE ENTIRE BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR COMMENT PRIOR TO THE FILING OF THE RETURN WITH THE IRS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ANNUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENTS ARE PREPARED BY EMPLOYEES AND BOARD MEMBERS. EACH STATEMENT IS REVIEWED BY THE CORPORATE COMPLIANCE OFFICER WHO DETERMINES IF ANY ACTION IS REQUIRED. A SUMMARY OF ALL NOTED CONFLICTS IS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD AUDIT COMMITTEE. SHOULD A POSSIBLE OR APPARENT CONFLICT BE NOTED, THE RESPONSIBLE PARTY WILL RECUSE HIM OR HERSELF FROM ANY DISCUSSIONS AND/OR DECISIONS PERTAINING TO THE CONFLICT.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE BOARD COMMITTEE ANNUALLY EVALUATES THE PRESIDENT/CEO'S PERFORMANCE AND USES AVAILABLE DATA FROM CONSULTANTS, SALARY SURVEYS AND SIMILAR ENTITIES' INFORMATIONAL FILINGS TO ENSURE THAT THE COMPENSATION OF THE PRESIDENT/CEO IS WITHIN FMV RANGE. THE COMMITTEE DECISION IS SHARED WITH THE ENTIRE BOARD, DOCUMENTED IN BOARD MINUTES, AND WRITTEN EMPLOYMENT CONTRACTS ARE DRAWN. THE PRESIDENT/CEO IS RESPONSIBLE FOR DETERMINING THE COMPENSATION FOR KEY EMPLOYEES. LOCAL SALARY SURVEYS ARE REFERENCED TO DETERMINE THE LOCAL MARKET RANGE FOR THE POSITION'S SALARY BEING NEGOTIATED.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST TO THE CORPORATE COMPLIANCE OFFICER. QUARTERLY FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE DISTRIBUTED BY MAIL TO BONDHOLDERS, THE FOUR NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED MUNICIPAL SECURITIES INFORMATION REPOSITORIES AND THE RESIDENT FINANCE COMMITTEE WITHIN 45 DAYS OF THE END OF THE QUARTER AND ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST TO THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER. THE ANNUAL AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE INCLUDED IN THE ANNUAL DISCLOSURE STATEMENT, WHICH IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: CHANGES IN NET ASSETS OR FUND BALANCES:

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION HAS NOT HAD ANY CHANGES IN THE PROCESSES USED BY THE COMMITTEE THAT ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT SINCE THE PRIOR YEAR.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 14
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION IS CURRENTLY IN THE PROCESSING OF DEVELOPING A DOCUMENT RETENTION POLICY AND WILL FORMALLY INTRODUCE THE POLICY ONCE ALL ANALYSIS OF AND DOCUMENTATION FOR THE POLICY IS COMPLETE.
